subject: AI & Agents
title: Labels and Supervision
description: A micro-lesson that makes Labels and Supervision usable.

hook.text: A child learns 'dog' because someone points at a dog and says 'dog.' Labels work the same way.

buildup.text: In supervised learning, each training example comes paired with the correct answer â€” the label.

discovery.text: Labels can be categories ('cat' or 'dog') or numbers (house price: $350,000).

twist.text: Labeling data is expensive. ImageNet required 25,000 workers to label 14 million images.

climax.text: The quality of labels directly determines the quality of the model. Garbage labels, garbage model.

punchline.text: AI learns from answers. The answers better be right.

quiz.question: What is a label in supervised learning?
options: The correct answer paired with each training example
